node(address).details: Returns the node hash for a given account's reverse records.

setName(string).details: Sets the `name()` record for the reverse ENS record associated with the calling account.

params.name: The name to set for this address.

returns._0: The ENS node hash of the reverse record.

setNameForAddr(address,string).details: Sets the `name()` record for the reverse ENS record associated with the addr provided account. Can be used if the addr is a contract that is owned by a SCW.

params.name: The name to set for this address.

returns._0: The ENS node hash of the reverse record.

setNameForAddrWithSignature(address,stri.details: Sets the name for an addr using a signature that can be verified with ERC1271.

params.name: The name of the reverse record
params.signature: The resolver of the reverse node

returns._0: The ENS node hash of the reverse record.

setNameForAddrWithSignatureAndOwnable(ad.details: Sets the name for a contract that is owned by a SCW using a signature

params.name: The name of the reverse record
params.owner: The owner of the contract (via Ownable)
params.signature: The signature of an address that will return true on isValidSignature for the owner

returns._0: The ENS node hash of the reverse record.

name(bytes32).notice: Returns the name associated with an ENS node, for reverse records. Defined in EIP181.

userdoc.notice: A L2 reverse resolver. Deployed to each L2 chain.
